action.primary: Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and alleviates pain

indications: Pain from Blood Stasis, especially due to traumatic injury such as injury from falls, fractures, contusions and sprains
Applied topically for bleeding due to external injury

action.primary: Protects the surface of ulcers, prevents decay and generates flesh

contraindications: Contraindicated internally during pregnancy or menstruation.
Contraindicated for those with bleeding due to Deficiency Heat.
Contraindicated for those with Blood Stasis signs or symptoms.

useCases: Trauma-induced pain, swelling or hemorrhage, especially in the chest and abdomen.
Bruising, swelling and pain from trauma.
Stops bleeding without causing Stasis for sores that have perforated but fail to heal.
As a powder topically for wounds from metal blades.
Topically for open sores with discharge of pus.
Amenorrhea and menstrual pain with abdominal masses due to Blood Stasis.
As a powder with grain-based liquor for External or traumatic injuries with excruciating pain.

notes: This herb has recently used for bleeding from the upper digestive tract.
This can be use as a stand-alone herb.

Xue Jie, Olibanum #{RuXiang} Ru Xiang and Myrrh #{MoYao} Mo Yao all promote movement of Blood, stop pain, generate flesh and assist in the healing of sores. Xue Jie enters the Blood Level and is most able to generate flesh, help heal sores and stop bleeding. Ru Xiang and Mo Yao both enter the Qi and Blood levels and are better at transforming Stasis, reducing swelling, and stopping pain and are most appropriate for Qi and Blood Stagnation in the chest and abdomen, pain in the joints due to Wind-Damp Bi and painful, swollen sores.
